data.question: What is the chemical formula of the crystalline product synthesized from Zn(NO3)2, terephthalic acid, and dabco?
What method was used to prove the guest-dependent dynamic behavior of the metal–organic framework?
What happens to the framework of the metal–organic material upon guest inclusion?
data.answer: The framework shrinks upon guest inclusion.

data.question: True or False: The guest-free framework 1 has smaller interconnected voids compared to its guest-included state.
What is the estimated guest-accessible volume for the framework 1?
What structural change occurs in the framework upon guest removal?
data.answer: The 1,4-bdc ligands become linear, resulting in a perfect 2D square grid.

data.question: True or False: The structural changes associated with guest removal are irreversible.
What is the BET surface area of the metal–organic framework 1?
How does the inclusion of benzene affect the framework structure?
data.answer: It leads to the shrinkage of pores and forms a 2D rhombic grid.

data.question: True or False: The hydrogen sorption capacity of the framework 1 is lower than that of any zeolites or metal–organic materials reported to date under the same conditions.
What is the maximum hydrogen sorption capacity of framework 1 at 1 bar pressure?
True or False: The guest-free framework 1 and the benzene-inclusion framework (1·2 C6H6) have the same overall framework connectivity.
What is the synthesis temperature for the crystalline product [Zn2(1,4-bdc)2(dabco)]·4 DMF·1=2H2O?
True or False: The dabco pillars in the framework are ordered along the crystallographic fourfold axis.
What is the yield of the crystalline product [Zn2(1,4-bdc)2(dabco)]·4 DMF·1=2H2O?
True or False: The 1,4-bdc linker is generally considered to be a linear and rigid linker.
What is the role of dabco in the structure of the metal–organic framework?
data.answer: Dabco acts as pillars to extend the 2D layers into a 3D structure.

data.question: What is the temperature range in which 1·4 DMF·1=2H2O loses its guest molecules?
True or False: The guest-free framework 1 has a smaller specific volume per Zn2 unit compared to the benzene-inclusion framework (1·2 C6H6).
What is the significance of the guest-dependent dynamic behavior of the metal–organic framework?
data.answer: It may find applications not only as a gas storage medium but also as a sensor.
